item.title: Amid increased momentum for defense, the NATO Innovation Fund refreshes its investment team
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: The NATO Innovation Fund (NIF) is entering a new chapter, marked by the arrival of two new partners and the departure of its penultimate founding team partner.

item.title: How a Y Combinator food-delivery app used TikTok to soar in the App Store
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: BiteSight is a food-delivery app that lets users watch videos of food before ordering. It also lets customers see what their friends have ordered and bookmark places to try out.

item.title: VC Victor Lazarte is leaving Benchmark to launch his own firm
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Lazarte has only been at Benchmark for two years. He backed startups like Mercor, HeyGen, and Decart AI.

item.title: Intel continues to pull back on its manufacturing projects
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Intel canceled multiple manufacturing projects in Europe and delayed its Ohio chip plant for the second time this year.

item.title: X to test using Community Notes to find the posts everyone likes
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: X is piloting a new feature that will help to identify the platform's best posts. The system is similar to how Community Notes fact-checking works.

item.title: Chime backer Lauren Kolodny bets on AI to revolutionize estate processing
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Acrew Capital's Kolodny led a $20 million Series A in Alix, a startup that uses AI to automate estate processing.

item.title: This industrial AI startup is winning over customers by saying it won’t get acquired
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: In a red-hot acquisition market, the CVector founders answer this key question in its first conversation with prospective customers.

item.title: AI companions: A threat to love, or an evolution of it?
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: As AI companions from companies like Replika, Character AI, and Nomi AI abound, love is no longer strictly human. In this debate, we ask the question of whether it should be, or whether dating an AI could be better than dating a human.

item.title: Apple iOS 26 public beta arrives
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Apple released iOS 26 in public beta. Here's everything you can expect, from the Liquid Glass design to features powered by Apple Intelligence.

item.title: Google’s new Web Guide search experiment organizes results with AI
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Google's new Search Labs experiment will organize the search results using AI smarts.

item.title: Amazon introduces a more affordable color screen Kindle
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Amazon launches a more affordable, $250 Colorsoft Kindle and a version for kids.

item.title: Preston Thorpe is a software engineer at a San Francisco startup — he’s also serving his 11th year in prison
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: A senior software engineer for Turso, Thorpe is part of an experimental program in the Maine state prison system that allows incarcerated people to work remote jobs from custody.

item.title: Spotify takes a swing at gaming with a mini golf game ahead of ‘Happy Gilmore 2’ release
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Netflix and Spotify teamed up to launch a golf-inspired game as a way to promote “Happy Gilmore 2,” which premieres on Netflix this Friday.

item.title: Cybercrime forum Leak Zone publicly exposed its users’ IP addresses
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: Exclusive: The popular "leaking and cracking" forum left one of its databases exposed to the internet without a password, exposing the IP addresses of its users logging in.

item.title: AI slop and fake reports are coming for your bug bounty programs
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: "We're getting a lot of stuff that looks like gold, but it's actually just crap,” said the founder of one security testing firm. AI-generated security vulnerability reports are already having an effect on bug hunting, for better and worse.

item.title: Samsung backs a video AI startup that can analyze thousands of hours of footage
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Memories.ai's platform can process up to 10 million hours of video. For companies with a lot of video to analyze, the startup wants to provide a contextual layer, complete with searchable indexing, tagging, segments and aggregation.

item.title: Google’s new AI feature lets you virtually try on clothes
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The feature is launching in the United States today, letting users try on apparel items in Google's Shopping Graph across Search, Google Shopping and product results on Google Images.

item.title: Snapchat will now let your friends know you’ve made it home safe
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Snap Map's new "Home Safe" feature sends one-time alerts to friends, so you don't need to remember to message others that you're back safely.

item.title: SoftBank-backed LegalOn lands $50M to streamline legal workflows with AI
item.dc:creator: Kate Park
item.description: LegalOn, which provides AI-powered contract review software for legal teams, has raised $50 million in a Series C round.

item.title: Mission Barns is betting that animal-free pork fat will make artificial meat delicious
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: It’s the first such product to reach the market, and it could unlock a host of fattened-up meat alternatives.
